zero_smul_is_bounded_under_le:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:219:4: warning: unsupported binary notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
theorem filter.tendsto.zero_smul_is_bounded_under_le {f : ι → α} {g : ι → E} {l : filter ι}
    (hf : tendsto f l ((nhds) 0)) (hg : is_bounded_under (· ≤ ·) l (norm ∘ g)) :
    tendsto (fun x => «expr • » (f x) (g x)) l ((nhds) 0) :=
  hf.op_zero_is_bounded_under_le hg («expr • » · ·) fun x y => (norm_smul x y).le
#align filter.tendsto.zero_smul_is_bounded_under_le filter.tendsto.zero_smul_is_bounded_under_le
unbounded_univ:
protected theorem normed_space.unbounded_univ : ¬bounded (univ : set E) := fun h =>
  let ⟨R, hR⟩ := bounded_iff_forall_norm_le.1 h
  let ⟨x, hx⟩ := normed_space.exists_lt_norm 𝕜 E R
  hx.not_le (hR x trivial)
#align normed_space.unbounded_univ normed_space.unbounded_univ
smul_tendsto_zero:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:219:4: warning: unsupported binary notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
theorem filter.is_bounded_under.smul_tendsto_zero {f : ι → α} {g : ι → E} {l : filter ι}
    (hf : is_bounded_under (· ≤ ·) l (norm ∘ f)) (hg : tendsto g l ((nhds) 0)) :
    tendsto (fun x => «expr • » (f x) (g x)) l ((nhds) 0) :=
  hg.op_zero_is_bounded_under_le hf (flip («expr • » · ·)) fun x y => ((norm_smul y x).trans (mul_comm _ _)).le
#align filter.is_bounded_under.smul_tendsto_zero filter.is_bounded_under.smul_tendsto_zero

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/-- If there is a scalar `c` with `‖c‖>1`, then any element with nonzero norm can be
moved by scalar multiplication to any shell of width `‖c‖`. Also recap information on the norm of
the rescaling element that shows up in applications. -/
theorem rescale_to_shell_semi_normed {c : α} (hc : 1 < «expr‖ ‖» c) {ε : exprℝ} (εpos : 0 < ε) {x : E}
    (hx : «expr‖ ‖» x ≠ 0) :
    ∃ d : α,
      d ≠ 0 ∧
        «expr‖ ‖» («expr • » d x) < ε ∧
          ε / «expr‖ ‖» c ≤ «expr‖ ‖» («expr • » d x) ∧ («expr‖ ‖» d)⁻¹ ≤ ε⁻¹ * «expr‖ ‖» c * «expr‖ ‖» x :=
  by
  have xεpos : 0 < «expr‖ ‖» x / ε := div_pos ((ne.symm hx).le_iff_lt.1 (norm_nonneg x)) εpos
  rcases exists_mem_Ico_zpow xεpos hc with ⟨n, hn⟩
  have cpos : 0 < «expr‖ ‖» c := lt_trans (zero_lt_one : (0 : exprℝ) < 1) hc
  have cnpos : 0 < «expr‖ ‖» (c ^ (n + 1)) := by
    rw [norm_zpow]
    exact lt_trans xεpos hn.2
  refine' ⟨(c ^ (n + 1))⁻¹, _, _, _, _⟩
  show (c ^ (n + 1))⁻¹ ≠ 0
  · rwa [ne.def, inv_eq_zero, ← ne.def, ← norm_pos_iff]
  show «expr‖ ‖» («expr • » (c ^ (n + 1))⁻¹ x) < ε
  · rw [norm_smul, norm_inv, ← div_eq_inv_mul, div_lt_iff cnpos, mul_comm, norm_zpow]
    exact (div_lt_iff εpos).1 hn.2
  show ε / «expr‖ ‖» c ≤ «expr‖ ‖» («expr • » (c ^ (n + 1))⁻¹ x)
  · rw [div_le_iff cpos, norm_smul, norm_inv, norm_zpow, zpow_add₀ (ne_of_gt cpos), zpow_one, mul_inv_rev, mul_comm, ←
      mul_assoc, ← mul_assoc, mul_inv_cancel (ne_of_gt cpos), one_mul, ← div_eq_inv_mul,
      le_div_iff (zpow_pos_of_pos cpos _), mul_comm]
    exact (le_div_iff εpos).1 hn.1
  show («expr‖ ‖» (c ^ (n + 1))⁻¹)⁻¹ ≤ ε⁻¹ * «expr‖ ‖» c * «expr‖ ‖» x
  · have : ε⁻¹ * «expr‖ ‖» c * «expr‖ ‖» x = ε⁻¹ * «expr‖ ‖» x * «expr‖ ‖» c := by ring
    rw [norm_inv, inv_inv, norm_zpow, zpow_add₀ (ne_of_gt cpos), zpow_one, this, ← div_eq_inv_mul]
    exact mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right hn.1 (norm_nonneg _)
#align rescale_to_shell_semi_normed rescale_to_shell_semi_normed
rescale_to_shell:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/-- If there is a scalar `c` with `‖c‖>1`, then any element can be moved by scalar multiplication to
any shell of width `‖c‖`. Also recap information on the norm of the rescaling element that shows
up in applications. -/
theorem rescale_to_shell {c : α} (hc : 1 < «expr‖ ‖» c) {ε : exprℝ} (εpos : 0 < ε) {x : E} (hx : x ≠ 0) :
    ∃ d : α,
      d ≠ 0 ∧
        «expr‖ ‖» («expr • » d x) < ε ∧
          ε / «expr‖ ‖» c ≤ «expr‖ ‖» («expr • » d x) ∧ («expr‖ ‖» d)⁻¹ ≤ ε⁻¹ * «expr‖ ‖» c * «expr‖ ‖» x :=
  rescale_to_shell_semi_normed hc εpos (ne_of_lt (norm_pos_iff.2 hx)).symm
#align rescale_to_shell rescale_to_shell
range_norm:

@[simp]
theorem range_norm : range (norm : E → exprℝ) = Ici 0 :=
  Subset.antisymm (range_subset_iff.2 norm_nonneg) fun _ => exists_norm_eq E
#align range_norm range_norm
range_nnnorm:

@[simp]
theorem range_nnnorm : range (nnnorm : E → nnreal) = univ :=
  (nnnorm_surjective E).range_eq
#align range_nnnorm range_nnnorm

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/

-- Here, we set a rather high priority for the instance `[normed_space α β] : module α β`
-- to take precedence over `semiring.to_module` as this leads to instance paths with better
-- unification properties.
-- see Note [lower instance priority]
-- Shortcut instance, as otherwise this will be found by `normed_space.to_module` and be
-- noncomputable.
theorem norm_smul [normed_space α β] (s : α) (x : β) : «expr‖ ‖» («expr • » s x) = «expr‖ ‖» s * «expr‖ ‖» x :=
  by
  by_cases h : s = 0
  · simp [h]
  · refine' le_antisymm (normed_space.norm_smul_le s x) _
    calc
      «expr‖ ‖» s * «expr‖ ‖» x = «expr‖ ‖» s * «expr‖ ‖» («expr • » s⁻¹ («expr • » s x)) := by rw [inv_smul_smul₀ h]
      _ ≤ «expr‖ ‖» s * («expr‖ ‖» s⁻¹ * «expr‖ ‖» («expr • » s x)) :=
        mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_left (normed_space.norm_smul_le _ _) (norm_nonneg _)
      _ = «expr‖ ‖» («expr • » s x) := by rw [norm_inv, ← mul_assoc, mul_inv_cancel (mt norm_eq_zero.1 h), one_mul]
      
#align norm_smul norm_smul

@[simp]
theorem norm_algebra_map_nnreal (x : nnreal) : «expr‖ ‖» (algebra_map (nnreal) 𝕜' x) = x :=
  (norm_algebra_map' 𝕜' (x : exprℝ)).symm ▸ real.norm_of_nonneg x.prop
#align norm_algebra_map_nnreal norm_algebra_map_nnreal

@[simp]
theorem norm_algebra_map' [norm_one_class 𝕜'] (x : 𝕜) : «expr‖ ‖» (algebra_map 𝕜 𝕜' x) = «expr‖ ‖» x := by

norm_algebra_map:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/

theorem norm_algebra_map (x : 𝕜) : «expr‖ ‖» (algebra_map 𝕜 𝕜' x) = «expr‖ ‖» x * «expr‖ ‖» (1 : 𝕜') :=
  by
  rw [algebra.algebra_map_eq_smul_one]
  exact norm_smul _ _
#align norm_algebra_map norm_algebra_map
noncompact_space:
/-- A normed vector space over a nontrivially normed field is a noncompact space. This cannot be
an instance because in order to apply it, Lean would have to search for `normed_space 𝕜 E` with
unknown `𝕜`. We register this as an instance in two cases: `𝕜 = E` and `𝕜 = ℝ`. -/
protected theorem normed_space.noncompact_space : noncompact_space E :=
  ⟨fun h => normed_space.unbounded_univ 𝕜 _ h.bounded⟩
#align normed_space.noncompact_space normed_space.noncompact_space
nnnorm_surjective:

theorem nnnorm_surjective : surjective (nnnorm : E → nnreal) := fun c =>
  (exists_norm_eq E c.coe_nonneg).imp fun x h => nnreal.eq h
#align nnnorm_surjective nnnorm_surjective

theorem lipschitz_with_smul [normed_space α β] (s : α) : lipschitz_with («expr‖ ‖₊» s) ((«expr • » · ·) s : β → β) :=

theorem inv_norm_smul_mem_closed_unit_ball [normed_space (exprℝ) β] (x : β) :
    «expr • » («expr‖ ‖» x)⁻¹ x ∈ closed_ball (0 : β) 1 := by
  simp only [mem_closed_ball_zero_iff, norm_smul, norm_inv, norm_norm, ← div_eq_inv_mul, div_self_le_one]

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
theorem interior_closed_ball' [normed_space (exprℝ) E] [nontrivial E] (x : E) (r : exprℝ) :
    interior (closed_ball x r) = ball x r :=
  by
  rcases eq_or_ne r 0 with (rfl | hr)
  · rw [closed_ball_zero, ball_zero, interior_singleton]
  · exact interior_closed_ball x hr
#align interior_closed_ball' interior_closed_ball'

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
theorem interior_closed_ball [normed_space (exprℝ) E] (x : E) {r : exprℝ} (hr : r ≠ 0) :
    interior (closed_ball x r) = ball x r := by
  cases' hr.lt_or_lt with hr hr
  · rw [closed_ball_eq_empty.2 hr, ball_eq_empty.2 hr.le, interior_empty]
  refine' subset.antisymm _ ball_subset_interior_closed_ball
  intro y hy
  rcases(mem_closed_ball.1 <| interior_subset hy).lt_or_eq with (hr | rfl)
  · exact hr
  set f : exprℝ → E := fun c : exprℝ => «expr • » c (y - x) + x
  suffices «expr ⁻¹' » f (closed_ball x (dist y x)) ⊆ Icc (-1) 1
    by
    have hfc : continuous f := (continuous_id.smul continuous_const).add continuous_const
    have hf1 : (1 : exprℝ) ∈ «expr ⁻¹' » f (interior (closed_ball x <| dist y x)) := by simpa [f]
    have h1 : (1 : exprℝ) ∈ interior (Icc (-1 : exprℝ) 1) :=
      interior_mono this (preimage_interior_subset_interior_preimage hfc hf1)
    contrapose h1
    simp
  intro c hc
  rw [mem_Icc, ← abs_le, ← real.norm_eq_abs, ← mul_le_mul_right hr]
  simpa [f, dist_eq_norm, norm_smul] using hc
#align interior_closed_ball interior_closed_ball

theorem frontier_closed_ball' [normed_space (exprℝ) E] [nontrivial E] (x : E) (r : exprℝ) :

#align frontier_closed_ball' frontier_closed_ball'

theorem frontier_ball [normed_space (exprℝ) E] (x : E) {r : exprℝ} (hr : r ≠ 0) : frontier (ball x r) = sphere x r :=
  by
  rw [frontier, closure_ball x hr, is_open_ball.interior_eq]
  ext x; exact (@eq_iff_le_not_lt (exprℝ) _ _ _).symm
#align frontier_ball frontier_ball

theorem exists_norm_eq {c : exprℝ} (hc : 0 ≤ c) : ∃ x : E, «expr‖ ‖» x = c :=
  by
  rcases exists_ne (0 : E) with ⟨x, hx⟩
  rw [← norm_ne_zero_iff] at hx
  use «expr • » c («expr • » («expr‖ ‖» x)⁻¹ x)
  simp [norm_smul, real.norm_of_nonneg hc, hx]
#align exists_norm_eq exists_norm_eq

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/

/-- If `E` is a nontrivial normed space over a nontrivially normed field `𝕜`, then `E` is unbounded:
for any `c : ℝ`, there exists a vector `x : E` with norm strictly greater than `c`. -/
theorem normed_space.exists_lt_norm (c : exprℝ) : ∃ x : E, c < «expr‖ ‖» x :=
  by
  rcases exists_ne (0 : E) with ⟨x, hx⟩
  rcases normed_field.exists_lt_norm 𝕜 (c / «expr‖ ‖» x) with ⟨r, hr⟩
  use «expr • » r x
  rwa [norm_smul, ← div_lt_iff]
  rwa [norm_pos_iff]
#align normed_space.exists_lt_norm normed_space.exists_lt_norm

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
theorem eventually_nhds_norm_smul_sub_lt (c : α) (x : E) {ε : exprℝ} (h : 0 < ε) :
    «expr∀ᶠ in , » "./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `«expr∀ᶠ in , »" ((nhds) x)
      («expr‖ ‖» («expr • » c (y - x)) < ε) :=
  have : tendsto (fun y => «expr‖ ‖» («expr • » c (y - x))) ((nhds) x) ((nhds) 0) :=
    ((continuous_id.sub continuous_const).const_smul _).norm.tendsto' _ _ (by simp)
  this.eventually (gt_mem_nhds h)

dist_smul:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
theorem dist_smul [normed_space α β] (s : α) (x y : β) :
    dist («expr • » s x) («expr • » s y) = «expr‖ ‖» s * dist x y := by
  simp only [dist_eq_norm, (norm_smul _ _).symm, smul_sub]
#align dist_smul dist_smul

theorem coe_homeomorph_unit_ball_apply_zero [normed_space (exprℝ) E] : (homeomorph_unit_ball (0 : E) : E) = 0 := by

closure_ball:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
theorem closure_ball [normed_space (exprℝ) E] (x : E) {r : exprℝ} (hr : r ≠ 0) : closure (ball x r) = closed_ball x r :=
  by
  refine' subset.antisymm closure_ball_subset_closed_ball fun y hy => _
  have : continuous_within_at (fun c : exprℝ => «expr • » c (y - x) + x) (Ico 0 1) 1 :=
    ((continuous_id.smul continuous_const).add continuous_const).continuous_within_at
  convert this.mem_closure _ _
  · rw [one_smul, sub_add_cancel]
  · simp [closure_Ico zero_ne_one, zero_le_one]
  · rintro c ⟨hc0, hc1⟩
    rw [mem_ball, dist_eq_norm, add_sub_cancel, norm_smul, real.norm_eq_abs, abs_of_nonneg hc0, mul_comm, ← mul_one r]
    rw [mem_closed_ball, dist_eq_norm] at hy
    replace hr : 0 < r
    exact ((norm_nonneg _).trans hy).lt_of_ne hr.symm
    apply mul_lt_mul' <;> assumption
#align closure_ball closure_ball
algebra_map_isometry:
/-- In a normed algebra, the inclusion of the base field in the extended field is an isometry. -/
theorem algebra_map_isometry [norm_one_class 𝕜'] : isometry (algebra_map 𝕜 𝕜') :=
  by
  refine' isometry.of_dist_eq fun x y => _
  rw [dist_eq_norm, dist_eq_norm, ← RingHom.map_sub, norm_algebra_map']
#align algebra_map_isometry algebra_map_isometry
abs_norm_eq_norm:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/

@[simp]
theorem abs_norm_eq_norm (z : β) : |«expr‖ ‖» z| = «expr‖ ‖» z :=
  (abs_eq (norm_nonneg z)).mpr (or.inl rfl)
#align abs_norm_eq_norm abs_norm_eq_norm
